item.title: Stanford Psychologist: The Dishwasher Rule Will Raise Your EQ and Your Cultural Intelligence
item.description: What does how you load the dishwasher have to do with dealing with emotions and cultural differences? Research says there’s more to it than you think.

item.title: Markets are usually bubbly in Jackson Hole week. This year that might not happen
item.description: Powell’s Jackson Hole speech looms as markets temper Fed rate-cut bets, with hot PPI data, labor market weakness, and tariff risks clouding outlook.

item.title: The ‘Bro IPO’ summer: Women are missing from boards and C-Suites in the current surge of public offerings
item.description: An analysis of IPO-related filings from the first two weeks of August show an alarming lack of gender diversity.

item.title: My Colleague’s Email Auto-Reply Says She Might Never Answer You
How Chili’s and Cheesecake Factory are defying consumer gloom and beating McDonald’s and Chipotle at their own game
item.description: Chili’s reported a 24% jump in same-store sales in its most recent earnings report.

item.title: This Startup’s Tech Could Help Simplify Our Electrified Future
item.description: DG Matrix’s solid-state transformers can help companies create microgrids by tying together solar panels, batteries, and more.

item.title: Originated in China, the “996” schedule of working 9am-9pm, 6 days a week comes to Silicon Valley
item.description: Some startups have embraced the hyper intense work style—but it may not last.

item.title: Fed Rate Cuts Take a Backseat to Powell’s Legacy at Jackson Hole
item.description: Markets still forecast a moderate pace of rate cuts even after Jerome Powell.
